Patient 14: A 65-year-old male with a history of Parkinson's disease and hypertension. His current medications include carbidopa-levodopa, amlodipine, and a low-dose aspirin. He has a family history of Parkinson's disease, with his father having been diagnosed in his late 60s. He has experienced orthostatic hypotension, leading to previous dose adjustments of his antihypertensive medication.
